faq.question: How can I find people I may be interested in?

answer.p: Perhaps the easiest way to find people is to use the people browser.
To illustrate this let us assume we want to discover people who are engaged with "access management" projects. To do this using the people browser we need to:
Click on "People Browser" in the main menu. We are initially presented with all the people in the registry.
Click "Access Management" in the category facet selector (on the right).

The results displayed now include only those people who work on projects related to access management. Note that the project facet browser has also been filtered to only those projects that are active in the access management field.

faq.question: How do I export data for use in my own application?

answer.p: There are two main ways of exporting data from Simal. One is to use the REST API , the other is to use one of the web based browsers to filter the information to the set of data you want and then export it using one of the export tools.

To do this click the orange scissors icon in the browsers once you have filtered the data accordingly. You will be presented with a number of export formats, select one and you will be presented with the data you require. Simply copy and paste it into your chosen application.
